name: Baker
description: The Baker's Line are characterized by their centuries-long life spans. Most are pollinators, feeding on sugar solutions like honey, nectar, or sap. The greenkings bred others to provide milk and eggs, honoring the baker's craft. An example from this lineage is the mammudo, a shy, thick-scaled monster that uses its long tongue to sip nectar from flute-shaped flowers. Baker-wilders are known for their patience, and whether or not they follow the Anathiren pastry tradition, they tend to specialize in desserts.

important_monsters.name: Sweetloaf
important_monsters.description: A gentle mammudo or other armored monster, who you accompany most days on long, rambling walks.

important_monsters.name: Huir
important_monsters.description: A moody chamig or other village-bearing monster, upon whose back you were born and raised.

important_monsters.name: Curly
important_monsters.description: An ornery myotak or other goat-like monster, who once headbutted you off a mountain because you wouldn't share your treats.

important_monsters.name: Pua Li
important_monsters.description: An easy-going pitangwa or other talkative monster, the bemused subject of several decades of experiments on monster cognition.

important_monsters.name: Mother-Mother
important_monsters.description: A venerated votra swarm or other collective monster, whose iterations your family has tended for generations.

name: Butcher
description: The Butcher's Line have metal or mineral growths. They're mostly scavengers and detritivores, with strong stomachs adapted to digesting food in various stages of decay. An example from this lineage is the kakwari, a heavyset, flightless bird with a long train of metal feathers, which rattle and flare when it becomes agitated. Butcher-wilders are comfortable with death, often shouldering the burden of the final blow so their companions can keep their hands clean.

important_monsters.name: Sunset Glory
important_monsters.description: A haughty kakwari or other flashy monster, who struts around the gardens when not training for shows.

important_monsters.name: Shattertooth
important_monsters.description: A bold crownwolf or other canine monster, who you feed the bones left over from butchering livestock.

important_monsters.name: Onion
important_monsters.description: An affectionate lapu-lapu or other wooly monster, whose enthusiastic cuddles can accidentally rub naked skin raw.

important_monsters.name: Maharla
important_monsters.description: A wary asewa or other molting monster, who you rarely see but who constantly leaves coils of rusting, shed skin around his territory.

important_monsters.name: Quiet Ko
important_monsters.description: An inscrutable shulu xie or other crystalline monster, whose frenzy you caught early and manage to this day.

name: Fisher
description: The Fisher's Line live in seas, lakes, and rivers. By far the largest lineage in terms of both diversity and population, it includes the mysterious leviathans that surround the One Land's coasts. An example from this lineage is the uopang, a regenerating crustacean who rips off its own claws to regrow them in different forms. Fisher-wilders stand on the precipice of the unknown, their mutations giving them access to distant and uncharted aquatic worlds.

important_monsters.name: A Nu
important_monsters.description: A lonely uopang or other shellfish monster, who you've kept secret and safe from hunters in a hidden inlet.

important_monsters.name: Longboy
important_monsters.description: A playful varithan or other sinuous monster, who won't eat anything unless you make a game of it.

important_monsters.name: Pichi-Chi
important_monsters.description: An indecisive zaili or other pinniped monster, an orphan pup you raised after finding her stranded on the beach.

important_monsters.name: Big Cheeks
important_monsters.description: A judgmental yudoubu or other piscine monster, who has a surprising ability to read the hidden intentions of strangers.

important_monsters.name: Melody
important_monsters.description: A clever shakoi or other ocean-going monster, who brings you treasures and junk scavenged from ancient shipwrecks.

name: Gardener
description: The Gardener's Line are grazing animals who manage the One Land's flora. Most are fleet-footed, relying on speed to evade predation, but others are stubborn and fierce, using horns and tusks to defend themselves. An example from this lineage is the golyak, a nimble ruminant with splayed horns that leaves shadow images of itself behind when it runs, confusing its pursuers. Gardener-wilders sometimes use wilderfruits and mushi (p. 269) to maintain vegetarian diets, and even those who eat meat try to minimize the blood they shed.

important_monsters.name: White Heart
important_monsters.description: An otherworldly golyak or other hoofed monster, who you've chased for years, just hoping to get a closer look.

important_monsters.name: Shu Shu
important_monsters.description: An oblivious zimmudo or other clawed monster, whose bamboo grove you've saved many times from destruction without her even realizing.

important_monsters.name: Booger
important_monsters.description: A confident jama-jama or other frugivorous monster, who has free reign to pillage the farmers' fields so long as you keep paying for the damages.

important_monsters.name: Mhen Tan
important_monsters.description: A placid cloudcollar or other long-necked monster, a therapy monster whose low song puts nervous hearts at ease.

important_monsters.name: Reaper
important_monsters.description: A fussy ko-ketak or other bladed monster, who is particular about the placement of every toy and food item in its lair.

name: Roaster
description: The Roaster's Line play with fire. Some use it to hunt or defend themselves, while others need heat to gestate or breed. Despite the wide berth other monsters give them, they play a key role in many ecosystems. An example from this lineage is the flintknuckle, a shaggy ape which pounds its fists together to create sparks and ignite its greasy outer coat of hair. Roaster-wilders have a reputation for cooking indulgent food, prioritizing rich, fatty deliciousness over any considerations for health or restraint.

important_monsters.name: Red Cape
important_monsters.description: A lethargic flintknuckle or other primate monster, a former circus act enjoying a quiet retirement.

important_monsters.name: Smokechaser
important_monsters.description: A shrewd hutangwa or other fire-spreading monster, whose capacity for arson you've used for selfish means.

important_monsters.name: Cinder
important_monsters.description: An independent hagsechu or other scuttling monster, who constantly gets into trouble when you're not looking.

important_monsters.name: Chan Tuai Sao
important_monsters.description: A voracious tsian xie or other floating monster, to whom the village sacrifices a freshly slaughtered wooda every full moon.

important_monsters.name: Little Ting
important_monsters.description: A fearless sposu or other spined monster, who has claimed the best territory from older and larger monsters through sheer audacity.

name: Roundsman
description: The Roundsman's Line are defined by change. Many can undergo a metamorphosis in response to environmental pressures, and others have highly adaptable forms of camouflage and mimicry. An example from this lineage is the zaswang, an arboreal cephalopod with a wily reputation, which has learned to forage leftovers in urban environments. Roundsman-wilders are also known as swing-wilders, helping wherever hands are short rather than specializing in a single discipline.

important_monsters.name: Shim
important_monsters.description: A curious zaswang or other tentacled monster, who you always leave a new puzzle box to play with when you cross paths.

important_monsters.name: Giantkiller
important_monsters.description: A hurt tatangwa or other color-changing monster, a survivor of trophy hunts whose trust you've earned with patience and effort.

important_monsters.name: Young Duke
important_monsters.description: A pampered kala-kala or other vocal monster, who was raised in captivity and can yowl (or squawk, or roar, or shriek) for hours until he gets his way.

important_monsters.name: Gravedigger
important_monsters.description: A frightening botabo or other urban monster, whose taste for human corpses gives it uncanny flashes of intelligence.

important_monsters.name: Zoujo
important_monsters.description: A loyal rakuzar or other metamorphosing monster, the only creature who still recognized you after your first dramatic transformation.

name: Saucier
description: The Saucier's Line exude secretions, from the toxic to the medicinal to the recreational. This lineage contains the greenkings' most esoteric experiments, such as oozes with no discernable organs and symbiotes that fuse with plants. An example from this lineage is the ziziwen, a gangly flying insect that copies mutations from other monsters by drinking their blood. Saucier-wilders have a reputation for being finicky and mercurial, seasoning everything to their inexplicable but unerring taste.

important_monsters.name: Ghan the Shadow
important_monsters.description: An opportunistic ziziwen or other blood-sucking monster, who the locals believe is a harbinger of doom.

important_monsters.name: Sya Mai
important_monsters.description: A particular onagung or other amorphous monster, who has a habit of suddenly deciding it hates its once-favorite food.

important_monsters.name: Halfoak
important_monsters.description: A patient rootcrab or other plant monster, who took up residence in an inconvenient location and hasn't budged since.

important_monsters.name: Fearnaught
important_monsters.description: A timid satra or other bioluminescent monster, a pet you've sworn to one day free from an irresponsible magistrate's ownership.

important_monsters.name: Mudbutt
important_monsters.description: A belligerent mongpo or other slimy monster, who sneezes thick mucus on you every time he sees you. But in an affectionate way. Probably.

name: Stockkeeper
description: The Stockkeeper's Line hoard their food, either in hidden stashes, fat stores on their bodies, or elaborate nests and lairs. Many live in colder climates, where they rely on their stores to survive harsh winters. An example from this lineage is the Asig icespider, a spindle-limbed arachnid which weaves tripwires of taut silk throughout its frozen forests. Stockkeeper-wilders use both mundane tools, like salt and fermentation, and extraordinary ones, like arksteel coolers, to make their supplies last, and their careful preparations provide the foundation for every hunt's success.

important_monsters.name: Lady Zida
important_monsters.description: An aloof Asig icespider or other web-weaving monster, who cares little for you, but whose glittering tapestries always leave you awestruck.

important_monsters.name: Crumbs
important_monsters.description: A lazy pondon or other burrowing monster, who needs hours of brushing every day to get the tangles out of its fur.

important_monsters.name: Bandit
important_monsters.description: A rude syowari or other magpie-like monster, whose obsession with shiny objects has led to it stealing your arksteel tool many times over.

important_monsters.name: Dustwing
important_monsters.description: A devoted lotangwa or other nesting monster, whose pair-bond with another female was so strong that you gave them an egg to raise together.

important_monsters.name: Happy Cho
important_monsters.description: A gregarious tanpo or other blubbery monster, whose preference for long soaks has made it the mascot for the local bathhouse.
